paragraphs.content: Chapter 21
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 21

paragraphs.content: But Job answered and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: But Job answered and said,

paragraphs.content: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

paragraphs.content: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

paragraphs.content: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?

paragraphs.content: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

paragraphs.content: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

paragraphs.content: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

paragraphs.content: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

paragraphs.content: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

paragraphs.content: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

paragraphs.content: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

paragraphs.content: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.

paragraphs.content: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

paragraphs.content: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

paragraphs.content: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

paragraphs.content: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.

paragraphs.content: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

paragraphs.content: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.

paragraphs.content: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

paragraphs.content: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

paragraphs.content: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

paragraphs.content: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

paragraphs.content: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.

paragraphs.content: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

paragraphs.content: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

paragraphs.content: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

paragraphs.content: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?

paragraphs.content: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

paragraphs.content: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

paragraphs.content: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

paragraphs.content: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.

paragraphs.content: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

paragraphs.content: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
